author: Sharon Short
title: Literary Life by Sharon Short
text:
Inspired by the 1995 Dayton Peace Accords that ended the war in Bosnia, the Dayton Literary Peace Prize ( www.daytonliterarypeaceprize.org ) is the only international literary peace prize awarded in the United States. This year’s winner in fiction is Josh Weil, for “The Great Glass Sea;” in nonfiction, the winner is Bryan Stevenson for “Just Mercy”
Publishers from around the world nominate books published the previous calendar year. Then, books are distributed to a wide array of First Readers, each of whom reads six books from either the nonfiction or fiction submissions. From their recommendations, a subset of the submitted books are then sent to a panel of Finalist Judges.
